Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பயனில பல்லார்முன் சொல்லல் நயனிலநட்டார்கண் செய்தலிற் றீது.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: To speak useless things in the presence of many is a greater evil than to do unkind things towards friends.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition illustrating a hierarchy of evil.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the left, a person is shown performing an ungracious or unkind act towards their own friends ('நயன் இல நட்டார் கண் செய்தல்'). This is depicted as a significant, dark stain of bad karma.
Layered_Composition.Background: On the right, a person is shown speaking useless, vain words before a large assembly of good people ('பயனில பல்லார் முன் சொல்லல்'). This act is shown to produce a far larger, darker, and more terrible stain of bad karma. It is the 'greater evil' ('தீது').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Speaking vain words in a worthy assembly is a worse sin than being unkind to one's own friends.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The size and intensity of the karmic stain is the visual measure of the evil of the act. The waste of a worthy assembly's time is shown to be a more profound sin than a personal betrayal of friendship.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Both scenes are cast in a dim, sinful light. However, the karmic stain on the right is a deeper, more menacing black and seems to spread further, indicating its greater evil.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A comparative shot that uses the symbolic karmic stains to visually weigh the two sins against each other.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with ethereal effects for the karmic stains.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting that visually represents the degree of sin.

Cultural_Anchors: Speaking useless things before many (பயனில பல்லார் முன் சொல்லல்)
